channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate Republicans confirmed 417 Trump nominees this year, exceeding expectations after rule change
item.description: Senate Republicans kicked off President Trump's second term by confirming his Cabinet faster than any of the three previous administrations, but slogg...

item.title: Republican lawmaker and notable Trump critic Ben Sasse announces stage 4 cancer: ‘Now marching to the beat of a faster drummer’
item.description: “I’m not going down without a fight," said the Ivy League-educated father of three.

item.title: Senate quietly works on bipartisan Obamacare fix as healthcare cliff nears

item.title: California can't hide students' gender identity in 'historic' legal win for parental rights
item.description: A federal judge ruled that California schools can't conceal students' opposite-sex gender identities from their families, delivering a smackdown of th...

item.title: JPMorgan to allow crypto trading for institutional clients in latest embrace of the sector
item.description: CEO Jamie Dimon appears to have reversed course from once equating Bitcoin with a “pet rock.”

item.title: Genocide Lie Enthusiasts Mourn the Collapse of the Genocide Lie
item.description: Anti-Israeli activists have never had much use for factual evidence — why start now?

item.title: Americans enjoy one refuge from inflation: The cheapest gas prices in years
item.description: Gas below $3 is a welcome relief to many Americans.

item.title: 5 Years Too Late, Fulton County Proves Trump’s Call To Raffensperger Right
item.description: If nothing comes of Fulton County’s admission, the implication will be that election laws can be treated as optional rather than binding.

item.title: Biden promised faster trains, Amtrak delivered slower ones
item.description: When Amtrak's new NextGen Acela trains rolled into a station in August, they were gleaming pieces of modern machinery.

item.title: Jay Kelly, or Why I Skipped the Sergio Leone Award
item.description: Jay Kelly reminds us that home isn’t merely a place to which you return. It’s a presence you build through daily acts of attention.

item.title: Supreme Court rules on legality of Trump National Guard deployment to Chicago
item.description: Trump's federalization of the National Guard has sparked a fierce debate across party lines, as Democrats denounce the push as unlawful and beyond the...

item.title: The Fed’s Phantom Tradeoff
item.description: A predictable, rules-based monetary policy would deliver the price stability that labor markets require to thrive.

item.title: What Issues Do Gen Z Conservatives Care About Most? I Asked AmFest
item.description: Affordability, immigration, and the sanctity of life emerged as top issues for young voters who attended AmericaFest.

item.title: ‘E Pluribus Unum’ Means That We’re One People, Not A ‘Nation Of Immigrants’
item.description: The U.S. is not for everyone. To keep the founding fathers' vision alive, it must be exclusive. We are not open to all comers.

item.title: NASCAR Legend Greg Biffle Died An American Hero
item.description: Greg Biffle not only succeeded in the highest levels of stock car racing but also helped his suffering fellow citizens after Hurricane Helene.

item.title: ‘Cruel, unnecessary, and irresponsible’: Advocacy group slams Trump’s plan to garnish wages of student loan borrowers in default
item.description: Student loan borrowers see the end of leniency during Biden's term.

item.title: Jared Polis Becomes the First Democratic Governor to Back Trump’s School-Choice Plan
item.description: The Colorado governor’s move to boost educational options is one his fellow Democrats should follow.

item.title: Democratic lawmaker sues to get Trump's name off the Kennedy Center
item.description: Rep. Joyce Beatty has sued President Trump to force the removal of his name from the Trump Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

item.title: The Heritage Foundation Implodes
item.description: Heritage has abandoned or downgraded its conservative commitments in pursuit of populist ideological fashions.

item.title: Student loan defaults trigger paycheck garnishment as Trump admin ends COVID-era pause
item.description: The Trump administration says wage garnishment for defaulted federal student loans will begin in January, ending a pandemic-era pause.

item.title: How The Southern Baptist Convention Blew Up Its Credibility To Appease The #MeToo Movement
item.description: The Southern Baptist Convention has squandered much of its moral credibility crusading for leftist causes, such as amnesty and DEI.

item.description: The biggest Epstein files information dump yet leaves questions unanswered.
